title: About
text: This site records the work and work-in-progress of the data team supporting the Know Systemic Racism project.

title: California Map With County Boundaries
text:
Code
from urllib.request import urlopen
import json
with urlopen('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/geojson-counties-fips.json') as response:
    counties = json.load(response)

import pandas as pd
# ** the file below is hosted locally but I could alternatively write code that removes all the non-CA fip codes from the DF 
df = pd.read_csv("one_col_raw.githubusercontent.com_plotly_datasets_master_fips-unemp-16.csv",  
                   dtype={"fips": str})
df_scatter = pd.read_csv("LEA-20230424.csv",  
                   dtype={"fips": str})

import plotly.express as px

fig_scatter = px.scatter_mapbox(df_scatter, lat='Latitude', lon='Longitude',
                  # color="Policy_Manual_Exists", 
                  # size="car_hours",
                  labels={'LEA_Type': 'LEA Type', 'Mil_Equip_Policy_Exists' : 'Military Equipment Policy Exists', 'Policy_Manual_Exists' : 'Policy Manual Exists','QA_Policy_Manual': 'Policy Manual Link'},  # replaces left hand name with right hand name in hover
                  hover_name='LEA_Name',
                  hover_data=['City', 'County', 'Site', 'LEA_Type', 'Mil_Equip_Policy_Exists', 'Military Equipment Inventory Exists', 'Policy_Manual_Exists', 'QA_Policy_Manual', ],
                  color_continuous_scale=px.colors.cyclical.IceFire, size_max=15, zoom=10,
                  mapbox_style="carto-positron")

fig = px.choropleth_mapbox(df, geojson=counties, locations='fips',
                           color_continuous_scale="Viridis",
                           range_color=(0, 12),
                           mapbox_style="carto-positron",
                           zoom=4.7, center = {"lat": 37.0902, "lon": -120.7129},
                           opacity=0.5,
                          )
fig.update_geos(fitbounds="locations", visible=False)
fig.update_layout(margin={"r":0,"t":0,"l":0,"b":0})
fig.add_trace(
    fig_scatter.data[0]
)
fig.show()

title: Search Bar To Search Information About California LEA’s
text:
Code
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("LEA-20230424.csv")

# prompt user to enter a zip code, city, or police department name
search_term = ""
search_term = input("Enter a zip code, city, or police department:")
while search_term != 'q':    
    # for exact LEA name searches
    if ('Department' or 'Attorney' or 'Police' or 'Office' or 'Sheriff') in search_term:
        rows = df.loc[df['LEA_Name'] == search_term]
    # for zip code searches 
    elif search_term.isdigit():
        rows = df.loc[df['Zip_Code'] == int(search_term)]
    # for city searches
    else: 
        rows = df.loc[df['City'] == search_term]
    if (len(rows) == 0):
        print("Couldn't find any matches. Please double-check your spelling and capitalization")
    else: 
        display(rows)
    search_term = input("Enter a zip code, city, or police department:")

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text: All of the projects below are in active development. If you are interested in learning more about Know Systemic Racism, see this post or contact Felicia Smith at felicias@stanford.edu

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
California Law Enforcement Agencies

data | search
This is a list of California law enforcement agencies with coordinate locations of headquarters and links to policy manuals and military equipment inventories.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
Knowledge Graph

data | app
The Know Systemic Racism Knowledge Graph is a project to construct a richly connected graph of events, people, organizations, and people to reveal connections between discrete collections of data and the people behind the data.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
California Map

view map | code


Code
from urllib.request import urlopen
import json
with urlopen('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/datasets/master/geojson-counties-fips.json') as response:
    counties = json.load(response)

import pandas as pd
# ** the file below is hosted locally but I could alternatively write code that removes all the non-CA fip codes from the DF 
df = pd.read_csv("one_col_raw.githubusercontent.com_plotly_datasets_master_fips-unemp-16.csv",  
                   dtype={"fips": str})
df_scatter = pd.read_csv("LEA-20230424.csv")

import plotly.express as px

fig_scatter = px.scatter_mapbox(df_scatter, 
                  lat='Latitude',
                  lon='Longitude',
                  # color="Policy_Manual_Exists", 
                  # size="car_hours",
                  labels={'LEA_Type': 'LEA Type', 'QA_Policy_Manual': 'Policy Manual Link'},  # replaces left hand name with right hand name in hover
                  hover_name='LEA_Name',
                  hover_data={
                                  'City': True, 
                                  'County': True, 
                                  'Site': True, 
                                  'LEA_Type': True, 
                                  'QA_Policy_Manual': True, 
                                  'Latitude':False,
                                  'Longitude': False
                              },
                  color_continuous_scale=px.colors.cyclical.IceFire, 
                  size_max=15, 
                  zoom=10,
                  mapbox_style="carto-positron")

fig = px.choropleth_mapbox(df, 
                           geojson=counties, 
                           locations='fips',
                           color_continuous_scale="Viridis",
                           range_color=(0, 12),
                           mapbox_style="carto-positron",
                           zoom=4.7, 
                           center = {"lat": 37.0902, "lon": -120.7129},
                           opacity=0.5,
                          )
fig.update_geos(fitbounds="locations", visible=False)
fig.update_layout(margin={"r":0,"t":0,"l":0,"b":0})
fig.add_trace(
    fig_scatter.data[0]
)

# customize hover label appearance
fig.update_layout(
    hoverlabel=dict(
        bgcolor="white",
        font_size=12,
        font_family="Rockwell"
    )
)

fig.show()



                                                


Nothing here, yet! It’s coming. It’s here!

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
Stanford Entities

data
This is the start of collecting graph data from Stanford-related library projects.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
Black@Stanford

demo| code | deprecated code
This is a prototype Question/Answer app that uses as the source a set of oral history transcripts from Black Stanford students and faculty.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
Digital Traces

data | code
This is graph data and a conversational interface to a neo4j database to query the graph. It is based on work done during the winter 2023 course Digital Traces.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
Simple Sabotage

paper
Nothing here, yet! For an article we will write during summer 2023.

title: Know Systemic Racism Data Projects
text:
California Military Equipment Inventory

code | urls-data | index-data
This is the code and data for an app in development that makes information about military equipment used by California law enforcement agencies discoverable.

title: know-systemic-racism
text:
Code
import pandas as pd

def make_clickable(val):
    # target _blank to open new window
    return '<a target="_blank" href="{}">{}</a>'.format(val, val)

sheet_url = 'https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IfK0gInyBM9KOhrxglCBqPp13fyX6ZjXVCQJDj-WGck/edit#gid=0'
url_1 = sheet_url.replace('/edit#gid=', '/export?format=csv&gid=')

df = pd.read_csv(url_1)
df.loc[:, ~df.columns.isin(['Unnamed: 6', 'Unnamed: 7', 'Unnamed: 8'])]

title: Search for California Law Enforcement Agencies (LEA)
text: This is a list of California law enforcement agencies that we have gathered and curated for the purpose of finding and tracking policy manuals and military equipment inventories. This list of LEAs was obtained from the California’s Commision on Police Officer Standards and Training

title: Search for California Law Enforcement Agencies (LEA)
text:
Search By Keyword

Notes

MEP = Military Equipment Policy
MEI = Military Equipment Inventory



Code
data = FileAttachment("LEA-20230424.csv").csv({ typed: true })

viewof search = Inputs.search(data, 
{placeholder: "Enter a zip code, county, city, or police department name", 
width: 900,
label: "Search LEAs"
})


















Code
viewof rows = Inputs.table(search, {
  header: {
    Ref: "Reference Number",
    LEA_Name: "LEA Name",
    Exact_Address: "Exact Address",
    Zip_Code: "Zip Code",
    LEA_Type: "LEA Type",
    Site: "LEA Website",
    Policy_Manual_Exists: "Policy Manual Exists?",
    Mil_Equip_Policy_Exists: "MEP Exists?",
    "Military Equipment Inventory Exists": "MEI Exists?",
    QA_Policy_Manual: "QA Policy Manual Link",
    QA_Mil_Equip_Policy: "QA MEP Link",
    "QA Mil_Equip_Inventory (if separate)": "QA MEI Link (if separate)"
  },
  format: {
    Zip_Code: x => x.toFixed(0),
  },
})
